content: melt the ice finger hat a tiny hat to warm your fingertip you choose which finger great to wear to outdoor gatherings with like-minded people sizes two sizes small-medium and medium-large ribbing will stretch materials needed needles sz 1 us 2 25mm double point needles set of 5 yarn fingering weight approximately 3 3 5 yards 1 clip on marker yarn needle to weave in yarn ends gauge too small to measure stitch glossary k2tog knit two together makes a right leaning decrease ssk slip one stitch knitwise slip the next stitch knitwise place both stitches back on the left needle their orientation on the needle has changed knit two together through the back loop makes a left leaning decrease hat s/m size written out numbers for m/l size appear in parentheses cast on 12 16 stitches divide on 4 needles 3/3/3/3 4/4/4/4 join in the round being careful to not twist place beginning of round marker work in k1 p1 ribbing for 8 rounds knit 3 rounds decrease rounds m/l size only ssk k2/k2 ssk repeat 12 st both sizes ssk k1/k1 k2tog repeat 8 st ssk k2tog repeat 4 st cut yarn leaving a 5 tail using the yarn needle draw the tail through the remaining 4 loops and pull tight closing the hole in the top of the hat leave the tail on the outside of the hat braid cut a 10 piece of yarn use the yarn needle to draw the yarn through the top of the hat pulling it halfway through now you have 3 strands of yarn including the tail 5 each to make the braid which needs gauge you can ask someone else to hold the hat clamp it or tape it to a table or hold it between your toes make a 3 strand tight braid about 1 25 long make an overhand knot at the end of the braid trim the braid 25 past the knot weave in the cast on end wear with pride you can use a marker or pen to draw a face on your finger below the hat copyright cheryl andrews 2026 1
